name: Rpi Home Controller
tagline: An easy to use set of scripts allowing you to access and control the GPIO of your Raspberry Pi
body:
### Overview
The RPi Home Controller is a simple, yet useful set of scripts allowing the control and interaction with the GPIO of your Pi.

### Features
* Aesthetically appealing web interface
* Synchronization across web clients
* An additional TCP socket server (for easy integration with third party applications)
* Fully customizable display
* And much, much more...

Working demo of web interface [here](http://therealtylerdurden.github.io/rpi-home-controller/html/)

### Install Dependencies
```
# pip install twisted autobahn jinja2
```

### Usage
```
$ git clone https://github.com/therealtylerdurden/rpi-home-controller.git
$ cd rpi-home-controller
# nohup python TCP_server.py & 
# nohup python WebSocket_server.py &
$ nohup python HTTP_server.py &
```

### Configuration
The configuration is located in `data.json`

Most of it is relatively self-explanatory, however, configuring groups needs to be explained:

```javascript
"Web": {
    "Groups": [
        {
            "description": "AC",    // "description" is the label displayed above the switch
            "gpiopin": "40"    // "gpiopin" is the pin on the Pi that will be toggled
        },
    ]
}
```
